title: What skills should I develop to start a career combating climate change? - Quora

response.answer_text: The skills of innovation delivery. We have all the solutions we need to reverse climate change within 30 years, and more inventions are coming to market every year. Project Drawdown’s ranked quantified list of solutions would be a great shopping list for technical careers. The fundamental challenge is that human systems are biologically evolved to resist change and conserve the status quo. So whatever career you decide to follow, make sure you skill up on implementation practices including: Systems ThinkingGenerative InnovationBehavioural EconomicsLean EntrepreneurshipDrawdown estimates savings of $74 trillion in shifting to an economy that consumes greenhouse gases. Separate research on the UN’s sustainable development goals quantified over $12 trillion in private sector opportunity. Dig into the technical solutions - but which ever profession you choose, remember: “Successful innovation is the adoption of a new practice by a community” - Denning and Dunham

Hopefully humorous, but true. The key skills you need are the ability to connect with today’s thinking, so you can translate it into thinking that will really work. We are at a point where people are recognizing that “sustainability” and “Renewable Energy” as it has been played so far just isn’t working. You need to learn to diagnose why that is and then get positioned to become an early mover in the renewable energy explosion that is going to happen when we start teaching folks how to get the full value out of renewable energy potential. Learn enough from the existing reality to be able to speak their language, but for God's sake, don’t drink the kool-aid.
